case.name: Cao v Minister for Immigration and Citizenship [2009] FCA 586 (18 May 2009)

citphrases.citphrase: whether notification of the decision was in the "prescribed way" under migration act 1958
whether notification by pre-paid post means the person is taken to have received the document
application to review decision of delegate
no information provided in prescribed time

citances.sentence: There are a number of other decisions that have applied that interpretation of s.494C(4): SZBMF v Minister for Immigration and Multicultural and Indigenous Affairs [2005] FCA 1427 ; [2005] FCA 1427 ; (2005) 147 FCR 485 (S.494C(4) ; Minister for Immigration and Citizenship v Manaf [2009] FCA 963 ; Swee Yen Tay v Migration Review Tribunal [2009] FCA 515 ; Swee Yen Tay v Migration Review Tribunal (No 2) [2009] FCA 591 ; Cao v Minister for Immigration and Citizenship [2009] FCA 586.
